It is characterized by its delicate, ribbon-like leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as gametangia, are borne on the upper surfaces of the leaves. Heterozeuxine nervosa plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
